intro: Schefferella bawun, commonly known as the Bawun tree, is a tropical plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in moist, fertile soils and is often found in lowland forests. Its botanical features make it an important component of the local ecosystem.
